Forms (ES)

Forms are the fields of information a user should input. Here are some examples:

  • A contact form containing a first name, last name, and email address.
  • A support request form containing first name, last name, email, and topic.

Data Sources (ES)

Data sources are where Formulate fetches data from or adds data to. Here are some examples:

  • A SQL database connection to store form submissions to.
  • A URL to fetch a list of countries from.

Data Values (ES)

Data values are displayed by form fields. Here are some examples:

  • A list of countries.
  • A "yes" or "no" (e.g., for use in a drop down).

Layouts (ES)

Layouts are where you can organize your form fields into custom layouts. Here are some examples:

  • A two-column grid.
  • A three-step wizard.

Validation Library (ES)

The validation library is where you can configure your validations for use on fields. Here are some examples:

  • A regular expression to validate the format of email addresses.
  • A validation that ensures the phone number entered by a user is not a known invalid phone number (e.g., one with a 555 area code).

You can read more about validations here: http://www.formulate.rocks/validations
